revised_title: Comparing Short-Period Inequalities in Sun-Spot Areas and Diurnal Temperature-Ranges
tldr: The authors investigate the relationship between short-period inequalities in sun-spot areas and diurnal temperature-ranges at Toronto and Kew. They find that sun-spot inequalities around 24 and 26 days have periods similar to terrestrial meteorological inequalities, with Toronto temperature-ranges exhibiting double oscillations and Kew temperature-ranges having a single oscillation.
